content:
Cannot start container... Port already in use: 5001 Look familiar?
If you’re anything like me, you frequently have multiple docker containers, ports forwarded, or just generally too many apps running on different ports.
Luckily, I have the solution. I call it whichport.
It’s a simple bash function. Just add the following to your ~/.bash_profile:
# find which process is running on a port, ex: `whichport 4200` whichport() { if [ -z "$1" ]; then echo "no argument supplied (enter port to check)" return 1 fi lsof -i:$1 | grep LISTEN; }
title: whichport - how to become a process detective

content:
I specialize in end-to-end ML challenges. I started my career in consulting, building data pipelines for Fortune 100 companies. Pivoted into the exciting world of ML and have built ground-up ML infra at multiple startups.
I could be a good fit if…
you need help with the “handoff” stage of ML lifecycle (putting models from the “Jupyter Notebook” stage to generating business value) you’re looking for a curious, product- and customer-minded ML engineer to build and ship your first ML model ground-up infrastructure for classical ML systems (predictive models, recommender systems) training / batch prediction pipelines RAG systems across clients and verticals self-hosted LLMs on GPUs Questions? # ‚úâÔ∏è Email me to chat about your project & see if there’s a fit.
